doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 29 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 7/14/1987]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 29 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 7/14/1987]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, Rev. Bernard Lynch and Eleanor Cooper, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign FundCOMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund2. Discussion about Catholicism and homosexuality.COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser3.Discusson about the differences between the way gay and straight communities responded to the AIDS crisis.4.News Watch, President Regan nominates Circuit Court of Appeals judge Robert H. Bork to the Supreme Court5.Personal advertisment placed by Ft. Worth police department seen as a attack on homosexuality by ACLU and Gay Alliance6.Committee of Outraged Lesbians (COOL) formed to combat racist or discriminatory practices in dance clubs urges the boycotting of events sponsored by Shescape Productions7. New ruiling by FDA makes Investigational New Drugs (IND) available to people suffering from serious diseases, GCN contacts FDA to see how this affects people with AIDS8.Lavender Health, Ellen Zaltzberg interviews Joe Stanton from Senior Action in Gay Enviornment (SAGE) about the services and history of the organization9.Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Naming Names, criticism of Natt Hemtoff's article which lambasts health professionals for not supporting mandatory testing for AIDSCOMMERCIAL: The Monster2.GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "Hair Today, Gone Tomorrow Pt. 2"COMMERCIAL: Manscape5."Suds": "East Meets West Side"
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 29 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 7/14/1987]: July 1987
